name: Pinto Bean and Rice Salad With Tomatoes and Cheddar in Banana Pepper-Chili Vinaigrette
description: The classic side dish of rice and beans gets a summery facelift in this bold, chilled salad, packed with tomatoes, sharp cheddar, onions, cilantro, and an in-your-face vinaigrette made with both banana peppers and ancho chilies.
recipeIngredient: 1 (14.5-ounce) can pinto beans, drained and rinsed
2 tablespoons finely chopped canned pickled banana peppers
1 tablespoon pickling liquid from pickled banana peppers
1 1/2 tablespoons minced cilantro leaves and tender stems

recipeInstructions.text: Place beans, rice, cheese, tomatoes, onion, and banana peppers in a medium bowl.
Whisk together pickling liquid, lime juice, olive oil, chile powder, and cayenne in a small bowl. Season with salt. Toss with bean mixture. Taste and adjust seasonings, if needed.
Place in the refrigerator and allow flavors to meld for at least 1 hour and up to 4 hours. Stir in cilantro and serve cold or at room temperature.
